::Prowl::

Prowl stands behind and slightly to the side of Iron Raptor, a bit 
taller than her. His thoughts were busy communicating with hers.

-He's got an interesting argument, love,- he thinks to her after 
Megaton's introduction, a bit amused. -If the leader of a Predacon 
faction is suicidal enough to walk up here alone, we might not want 
to ally with a whole group of him.-

After a slight momentary pause, Prowl continues. He was used to being 
a military advisor, and this is what he usually did anyways.

-Although helping him defeat the other Predacon leaders and unite the 
Predacons, if that's what he's getting at, would be kinda suicidal 
for us. I doubt this bot would pause for a second before turning on 
the ones that helped him gain power.-

He smiles to himself under his faceplate, which had come up along 
with his helm in case of battle. This ability of his and Iron 
Raptor's to communicate with each other over thought has just 
revealed a new advantage.




--- In nbwrpg@y..., "CYBERWOLF4" <cyberwolf4@p...> wrote:
> then here
> 
> Megaton stopped about twenty feet away from Iron Raptor. His 
towering form
> placed her in his shadow. The dragon took a good close look at the 
bot who
> appeared to be in charge. Her look had changed since the predacon 
files he'd
> studied but there was no mistaking that the bot standing tall 
before him was
> none other than Iron Raptor.
> 
> Transforming to his freakish robot mode Megaton shrunk down to a 
size more
> compatible with hers. He still stood slightly taller than her but 
they were
> now equals none the less. "My name, my dear, is Megaton, rank will 
be leader
> of all predacons." He stepped back a step to appear less 
menacing. "As you
> may already know the Predacons are split into seperate factions 
making my
> opposition ripe targets. Destroy the other leaders and the 
Predacons will be
> reunited." He knew that the information he was giving the maximals 
didn't
> sound very convincing but there was a twist that he'd left out. "I 
know that
> you've recently taken quite a bit of damage from attacks, I offer 
the
> protection of my faction in return for your assistance." As added 
incentive
> he added, "If a single bot such as myself walked up to your front 
door
> imagine what a group with a dozen warriors could do."
